title: Julio Iglesias, Royal Albert Hall, review: an old-fashioned but touching evening with the great Latin crooner
text:
There was a touching vulnerability to Julio Iglesias as the great Latin crooner returned to the Royal Albert Hall, “the most beautiful theatre in the world” for “maybe the last time”.

At 76, his mobility is restricted, and there is a patina of fragility to his voice, though he remains an accomplished singer and commanding presence. He sat propped between a stool and table towards the back of the stage, never venturing forward, eyes closed as he sang, as if lost in melody and emotion. “That was a time!” he sighed with rapture as he summoned memories from his past, whether performing in London for the first time in 1973 (“I told you I would be back”) or seeing Jaques Brel (“the most beautiful singer...
description: There was a touching vulnerability to Julio Iglesias as the great Latin crooner returned to the Royal Albert Hall, “the most beautiful theatre in the world” for “maybe the last time”.
